thread.section_title: Manchester United’s Zlatan Ibrahimovic admits he’s still out to prove Pep Guardiola wrong – Metro
thread.title: Manchester United’s Zlatan Ibrahimovic admits he’s still out to prove Pep Guardiola wrong
thread.title_full: Manchester United’s Zlatan Ibrahimovic admits he’s still out to prove Pep Guardiola wrong

author: markbrus88
title: Manchester United’s Zlatan Ibrahimovic admits he’s still out to prove Pep Guardiola wrong
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic has been a hit in the Premier League (Picture: Getty) Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic admits he’s still motivated by Pep Guardiola snubbing him during their time together at Barcelona.
Who's he!? Arsenal legend unimpressed by leading candidate to replace Wenger The Swede spent one season with the Manchester City boss at the Nou Camp during 2009/10, but failed to get going under his very specific style of management.
Ibrahimovic has generally worked better under Jose Mourinho, reaching some of the best form of his career under the United boss when they were together at Inter Milan.
Ibrahimovic had a tough time under Guardiola at Barcelona (Picture: Getty) The pair are back together at Old Trafford this season, and they are very much united in their issues with Guardiola.
Ibrahimovic on Guardiola vs Mourinho ‘Jose Mourinho is Guardiola’s opposite. If Mourinho brightens up the room, Guardiola pulls down the curtains’ ‘I learned a lot from Barcelona, on and off the pitch. I learned that in football any situation can change in 24 hours,’ Ibrahimovic told Sky Italia.
‘The problem wasn’t with me, it was with him (Guardiola) and he never came to terms with it. I don’t know what his problem was with me.
‘Before (I joined Barcelona) he was calling me every day to get me and then all of a sudden the situation changed.
More: Football Arsenal handed major blow as key star is ruled out for FOUR WEEKS 
Time for a reality check: Arsenal is as good as it's going to get for Mesut Ozil 
Man Utd star admits David de Gea joining Real Madrid this summer is a scary possibility 
‘It is something that drives me, gives me adrenaline, and extra motivation. It is normal, after what has happened.
‘I’m using it as a positive, not a negative. It is something in the back of my mind. It is the past and I am someone who looks to the future and the future is in front of me.’
MORE: Wayne Rooney move from Manchester United to Everton ‘likely to happen’
